required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Determine the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of UV-4B Solution Administered Orally in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group, Single-Ascending Dose Study to Determine the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of UV-4B Solution Administered Orally in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of a single-ascending oral dose of UV-4B in healthy subjects and to determine pharmacokinetic parameters describing absorption and elimination following a single dose of UV-4B in healthy subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: The causative agent of dengue fever is Dengue Virus (DENV), a member of the flavivirus genus. There are four DENV serotypes. Infection with one serotype results in lifelong immunity against that serotype, but only limited short-term cross-protection from infection with the other serotypes. Immunity to one serotype has a downside as subsequent infections by other serotypes increase the risk of developing more severe forms of dengue, which includes the most lethal form of the disease, dengue hemorrhagic fever. Traditional epidemiologic and serologic-based estimates suggest a range of 50 to 100 million DENV infections per year distributed over 100 countries. Recent cartographic-based modeling studies suggest that up to 390 million of dengue infections per year, of which 96 million are associated with clinical symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAEs) by Treatment Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of the first dose administration through Day 9 ± 1
primary_outcome.description: TEAEs are those AEs occurring only after administration of investigational product

primary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Serious Adverse Event (SAEs) by Treatment Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of the first dose administration through Day 9 ± 1
primary_outcome.description: Subjects with AEs considered serious by the investigator

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Vital Sign Values of Toxicity Grade 1 or Higher Postdose by Treatment Group (Safety Population)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of the first dose administration through Day 9 ± 1
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects in a treatment group, who had a vital sign value of toxicity Grade 1 or higher: supine and standing systolic blood pressure (BP), supine and standing diastolic BP, supine and standing pulse rate, respiratory rate, and temperature

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Electrocardiogram Outlier Values Postdose by Treatment Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of the first dose administration through Day 9 ± 1
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects in a treatment group with outlier ECG findings: QTcF (Fridericia's), PR, and QRS intervals

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Clinical Laboratory Test Results of Toxicity Grade 1 or Higher at Day 9 by Treatment Group
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with Grade 1 toxicity or higher for hematology, coagulation, chemistry and urinalysis analytes. ULN=upper limit of normal; WBC=white blood cell count.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration, obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax is the time of maximum concentration observed directly from the observed concentration versus time data.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-last) is the area under the concentration-time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to time of last quantifiable concentration, calculated by linear up/log down trapezoidal summation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-inf) is the area under the concentration-time curve in the sample from pre-dose extrapolated to infinite time, calculated by linear up/log down trapezoidal summation and extrapolated to infinity by addition of the last quantifiable concentration divided by the apparent terminal rate constant: AUC(0-last) - C(last)/λ(z).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
secondary_outcome.description: CL/F is the apparent systematic clearance, calculated as dose (free-base equivalent) divided by AUC(0-inf).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
secondary_outcome.description: Vz/F is the apparent volume of distribution of UV-4 based on the terminal phase, calculated as dose (free-base equivalent) divided by [λ(z) × AUC(0-inf)].

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
secondary_outcome.description: t(1/2) is the apparent terminal half-life, determined as ln(2)/λ(z).

secondary_outcome.measure: Interval and Cumulative Amount (mg) of UV-4 Excreted in Urine, Ae, by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pooled urine samples were collected at predose (-12 to 0 hour), and from 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Ae is the by-interval and cumulative amounts of UV-4 drug excreted in urine. Intervals were 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours postdose. Ae by-interval amounts were calculated as the product of urine volume and urine concentration. Ae(0-last) is the cumulative amount of UV-4 drug excreted in urine over the entire collection period, 48 hours. Cumulative amounts were calculated as the summation of the amounts excreted in collection intervals.

secondary_outcome.measure: Interval and Cumulative Percent of UV-4 Excreted in Urine, fe, by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pooled urine samples were collected at predose (-12 to 0 hour), and from 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours postdose
secondary_outcome.description: fe is the by-interval percentage of UV-4 drug excreted in urine. Intervals were 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours postdose. fe = Ae/(UV-4B dose x 100). fe(0-12), fe(0-24) and fe(0-last) are the cumulative percentages of UV-4 drug excreted in urine over 24 hours and the entire collection period, respectively.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
secondary_outcome.description: CLr is the renal clearance, calculated at Ae(0-last) divided by AUC(0-last).

arm_group.description: Subjects receiving UV-4B 3 mg oral solution or placebo
Subjects receiving UV-4B 10 mg oral solution or placebo
Subjects receiving UV-4B 30 mg oral solution or placebo
Subjects receiving UV-4B 90 mg oral solution or placebo
Subjects receiving UV-4B 180 mg oral solution or placebo
Subjects receiving UV-4B 360 mg oral solution or placebo
Subjects receiving UV-4B 720 mg oral solution or placebo
Subjects receiving UV-4B 1000 mg oral solution or placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects
- Women: non-pregnant, non-lactating; if of childbearing potential, on specified contraception measures during the study period
- Men: using barrier contraception measures during the study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Health conditions
- Taking prescription and non-prescription drugs (exceptions: acetaminophen, vitamins, hormonal birth control)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a single center study performed in the United States. The study was completed with a total of 64 patients enrolled.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Each cohort was assigned 6 subjects who received the cohort's prescribed dose of UV-4B, along with 2 subjects in each cohort assigned to receive placebo.

baseline.population: Total number of randomized subjects in each cohort

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

class.title: Urine red blood cell count ≥ 1 rbc/hpf

outcome.title: Cmax by Treatment Group: UV-4
outcome.description: Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration, obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

measure.title: Cmax by Treatment Group: UV-4
measure.description: Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration, obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

outcome.title: Tmax by Treatment Group: UV-4
outcome.description: Tmax is the time of maximum concentration observed directly from the observed concentration versus time data.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

measure.title: Tmax by Treatment Group: UV-4
measure.description: Tmax is the time of maximum concentration observed directly from the observed concentration versus time data.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

outcome.title: AUC(0-last) by Treatment Group: UV-4
outcome.description: AUC(0-last) is the area under the concentration-time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to time of last quantifiable concentration, calculated by linear up/log down trapezoidal summation.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

measure.title: AUC(0-last) by Treatment Group: UV-4
measure.description: AUC(0-last) is the area under the concentration-time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to time of last quantifiable concentration, calculated by linear up/log down trapezoidal summation.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

outcome.title: AUC(0-inf) by Treatment Group: UV-4
outcome.description: AUC(0-inf) is the area under the concentration-time curve in the sample from pre-dose extrapolated to infinite time, calculated by linear up/log down trapezoidal summation and extrapolated to infinity by addition of the last quantifiable concentration divided by the apparent terminal rate constant: AUC(0-last) - C(last)/λ(z).
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B. Subjects in this population were used for all PK summaries.

measure.title: AUC(0-inf) by Treatment Group: UV-4
measure.description: AUC(0-inf) is the area under the concentration-time curve in the sample from pre-dose extrapolated to infinite time, calculated by linear up/log down trapezoidal summation and extrapolated to infinity by addition of the last quantifiable concentration divided by the apparent terminal rate constant: AUC(0-last) - C(last)/λ(z).
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B. Subjects in this population were used for all PK summaries.

outcome.title: CL/F by Treatment Group: UV-4
outcome.description: CL/F is the apparent systematic clearance, calculated as dose (free-base equivalent) divided by AUC(0-inf).
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

measure.title: CL/F by Treatment Group: UV-4
measure.description: CL/F is the apparent systematic clearance, calculated as dose (free-base equivalent) divided by AUC(0-inf).
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

outcome.title: Vz/F by Treatment Group: UV-4
outcome.description: Vz/F is the apparent volume of distribution of UV-4 based on the terminal phase, calculated as dose (free-base equivalent) divided by [λ(z) × AUC(0-inf)].
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

measure.title: Vz/F by Treatment Group: UV-4
measure.description: Vz/F is the apparent volume of distribution of UV-4 based on the terminal phase, calculated as dose (free-base equivalent) divided by [λ(z) × AUC(0-inf)].
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

outcome.title: t(1/2) by Treatment Group: UV-4
outcome.description: t(1/2) is the apparent terminal half-life, determined as ln(2)/λ(z).
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

measure.title: t(1/2) by Treatment Group: UV-4
measure.description: t(1/2) is the apparent terminal half-life, determined as ln(2)/λ(z).
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

outcome.title: Interval and Cumulative Amount (mg) of UV-4 Excreted in Urine, Ae, by Treatment Group
outcome.description: Ae is the by-interval and cumulative amounts of UV-4 drug excreted in urine. Intervals were 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours postdose. Ae by-interval amounts were calculated as the product of urine volume and urine concentration. Ae(0-last) is the cumulative amount of UV-4 drug excreted in urine over the entire collection period, 48 hours. Cumulative amounts were calculated as the summation of the amounts excreted in collection intervals.
outcome.time_frame: Pooled urine samples were collected at predose (-12 to 0 hour), and from 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours postdose
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B. Subjects in this population were used for all PK summaries.

measure.title: Interval and Cumulative Amount (mg) of UV-4 Excreted in Urine, Ae, by Treatment Group
measure.description: Ae is the by-interval and cumulative amounts of UV-4 drug excreted in urine. Intervals were 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours postdose. Ae by-interval amounts were calculated as the product of urine volume and urine concentration. Ae(0-last) is the cumulative amount of UV-4 drug excreted in urine over the entire collection period, 48 hours. Cumulative amounts were calculated as the summation of the amounts excreted in collection intervals.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B. Subjects in this population were used for all PK summaries.

outcome.title: Interval and Cumulative Percent of UV-4 Excreted in Urine, fe, by Treatment Group
outcome.description: fe is the by-interval percentage of UV-4 drug excreted in urine. Intervals were 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours postdose. fe = Ae/(UV-4B dose x 100). fe(0-12), fe(0-24) and fe(0-last) are the cumulative percentages of UV-4 drug excreted in urine over 24 hours and the entire collection period, respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Pooled urine samples were collected at predose (-12 to 0 hour), and from 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours postdose
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

measure.title: Interval and Cumulative Percent of UV-4 Excreted in Urine, fe, by Treatment Group
measure.description: fe is the by-interval percentage of UV-4 drug excreted in urine. Intervals were 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours postdose. fe = Ae/(UV-4B dose x 100). fe(0-12), fe(0-24) and fe(0-last) are the cumulative percentages of UV-4 drug excreted in urine over 24 hours and the entire collection period, respectively.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing for UV-4B.

outcome.title: CLr by Treatment Group: UV-4
outcome.description: CLr is the renal clearance, calculated at Ae(0-last) divided by AUC(0-last).
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected at predose (0 hour) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 hours postdose (1 hour window for predose)
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing.L/h

measure.title: CLr by Treatment Group: UV-4
measure.description: CLr is the renal clearance, calculated at Ae(0-last) divided by AUC(0-last).
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population consisted of all subjects who received active investigational product, UV-4B, and had at least 1 measured concentration at a scheduled PK time after start of dosing.L/h

reported_events.time_frame: From time of the first dose administration through 9 ± 1 days after dosing
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were coded by the Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) according to system organ class (SOC) and preferred term (PT).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor will make the results of the study publicly available, including for purposes of national and international registration, publication, and information for medical and pharmaceutical professionals.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Timothy Babinchak, MD, Vice President Clinical and Medical Affairs
